items.headline: ‘The world feels unpredictable’: I’m 56. My husband is 64. Our mortgage costs $17K a month. Do we pay it off?
items.summary_en: “We paid $3.1 million for the house and owe $1.3 million on the loan.”

items.headline: Bayer shares make this surprising move after $7.25 billion Roundup settlement accord
items.summary_en: Bayer stock slumped on Wednesday as the German giant set a preliminary accord to cap litigation over its weedkiller Roundup.

items.headline: ‘His credit rating is wrecked’: My son and his girlfriend mingled their finances. Big mistake.
items.summary_en: “She was a shopper and spent over $1,000 a month on weight-loss drugs.”

items.headline: Musician Post Malone’s childhood home in Texas is up for sale for just $549,000
items.summary_en: Post Malone’s “famous” childhood home in Texas has hit the market for $549,000—over a decade after he traded the Lone Star State for California amid his stratospheric rise to stardom.

items.headline: Why ECB’s Lagarde may leave her post early
items.summary_en: The Financial Times is reporting Lagarde may leave her office a year ahead of schedule. The ECB hasn’t denied it.

items.headline: Stanley Druckenmiller made a big bet on this country, and it’s already paid off
items.summary_en: Famed investor Stanley Druckenmiller, who mentored both Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Fed Chair nominee Kevin Warsh, looks to have already made a handsome profit with a well-time bet on Brazil.

items.headline: Here’s how strong the S&P 500 performs when inflation is falling rather than rising
